article_title: Police Say Mobridge Woman's Child Fell From 3-Story Window
article_text:
Mobridge, SD

A Mobridge woman whose 2-year-old child allegedly fell from a three-story window has been charged with felony child abuse.



Twenty-seven-year-old Irene Thompson also faces a misdemeanor charge of contributing to the abuse, neglect or delinquency of a minor.



Mobridge police investigator Al Bohle says that someone walking by found the child outside on the gravel-covered ground beneath an apartment window on Wednesday. It's unknown how long the child had been there.



The American News reports that authorities found the child with "injuries conducive to a fall," which included a broken arm.



Thompson is being held at the Walworth County Jail.



It's unclear whether Thompson has an attorney.
